pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:0.4.eng: The second training rule on bad behavior

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī saṅghena samanubhaṭṭhā bhikkhuniyo evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā had been pressed by the Sangha. She then said to the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.3.pli: “saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharittha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.3.eng: “Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.4.pli: Santi saṅghe aññāpi bhikkhuniyo evācārā evaṃsaddā evaṃsilokā, bhikkhunisaṅghassa vihesikā, aññamaññissā vajjappaṭicchādikā. Tā saṅgho na kiñci āha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.4.eng: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety,  and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Sangha says nothing to them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.5.pli: Tumhaññeva saṅgho uññāya paribhavena akkhantiyā vebhassiyā dubbalyā evamāha— ‘bhaginiyo kho saṃsaṭṭhā viharanti pāpācārā pāpasaddā pāpasilokā, bhikkhunisaṅghassa vihesikā, aññamaññissā vajjappaṭicchādikā. Viviccathāyye. Vivekaññeva bhaginīnaṃ saṅgho vaṇṇetī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.5.eng: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, impatience, and slander, and because you are weak that the Sangha says to you, ‘Sisters, you socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses. Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.5.comm: In the sequence uññāya paribhavena akkhantiyā vebhassiyā dubbalyā every word seems to be in the instrumental case except dubbalyā, which presumably is an ablative. This is unusual. The commentary, at Sp 2.727, says: Dubbalyāti tumhākaṁ dubbalabhāvena, “Dubbalyā: because of your weakness.” This implies that dubbalyā is the only word in the sequence that does not refer to the Sangha, but rather to the misbehaving nuns, which would be odd. Yet the commentarial interpretation is supported by the word commentary below, which defines dubbalyā as apakkhatā , “because of lack of supporters”. I therefore feel compelled to follow the commentarial interpretation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.7.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā, after being pressed by the Sangha, say this to the nuns?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.8.pli: saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharittha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that after being pressed by the Sangha, the nun Thullanandā said this to the nuns?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.32.pli: Evañca sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyya, sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.32.eng: If that nun continues as before, the nuns should press her up to three times to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.33.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsīyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.33.eng: If she then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.34.pli: no ce paṭinissajjeyya, ayampi bhikkhunī yāvatatiyakaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:1.34.eng: If she does not stop, then after the third announcement that nun too has committed an offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.6.pli: “saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharittha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.8.eng: It’s because of disrespect that the Sangha … to you:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.17.comm: That is, a lack of other nuns who support them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.24.eng: other nuns who see it or hear about it. They should correct her like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.26.pli: ‘saṃsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha. Mā tumhe nānā viharittha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.29.eng: And they should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.31.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.32.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.33.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.34.eng: That nun, even if she has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.36.eng: ‘Venerables, you should socialize. Don’t live separately.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.37.eng: There are other nuns in the Sangha …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.38.eng: “… Be secluded, Venerables. The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.”’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.39.eng: They should correct her a second

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.41.eng: If she stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.42.eng: If she does not stop, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.44.eng: “And, monks, she should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.45.eng: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.46.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.47.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmā bhikkhunī saṅghena samanubhaṭṭhā bhikkhuniyo evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.47.eng: The nun so-and-so, after being pressed by the Sangha, says this to the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.50.eng: There are other nuns in the Sangha who have such behavior, reputation, and notoriety, and who harass the Sangha of nuns and hide each other’s offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.51.eng: The Sangha says nothing to them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.52.eng: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, impatience, and slander, and because you are weak that the Sangha says to you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.53.pli: bhaginiyo kho saṃsaṭṭhā viharanti pāpācārā pāpasaddā pāpasilokā, bhikkhunisaṅghassa vihesikā aññamaññissā vajjappaṭicchādikā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.53.eng: ‘Sisters, you socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.55.eng: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.56.eng: And she keeps on saying it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.57.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.59.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.64.eng: The Sangha says nothing to them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.66.eng: ‘Sisters, you socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Sangha of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.68.eng: The Sangha praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.69.eng: And she keeps on saying it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.70.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuniṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.70.eng: The Sangha presses her to make her stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.71.pli: Yassā ayyāya khamati itthannāmāya bhikkhuniyā samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, sā tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.71.eng: Any nun who approves of pressing her to make her stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.72.eng: Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.73.eng: For the second time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.74.eng: For the third time I speak on this matter …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.75.pli: Samanubhaṭṭhā saṅghena itthannāmā bhikkhunī tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.75.eng: The Sangha has pressed nun so-and-so to stop.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.76.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.76.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.77.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.77.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.78.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.79.eng: When the last announcement is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.80.pli: Saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjantiyā ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ, dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā paṭippassambhanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.80.eng: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.82.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.84.eng: there is an offense when she has been pressed for the third time, not as soon as the misconduct has been committed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.86.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.88.pli: saṅghova tassā āpattiyā mānattaṃ deti, mūlāya paṭikassati, abbheti, na sambahulā na ekā bhikkhunī. Tena vuccati “saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.88.eng: only the Sangha gives the trial period for that offense, sends back to the beginning, and rehabilitates—not several nuns, not an individual nun. Therefore it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.89.pli: Tasseva āpattinikāyassa nāmakammaṃ adhivacanaṃ, tenapi vuccati “saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:2.89.eng: This is the name and designation of this class of offense. Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematikā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññā na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she does not stop, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.8.eng: if she has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.11.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.12.eng: The thirteenth offense entailing suspension is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.12.comm: The nuns’ offenses entailing suspension 14, 15, 16, and 17 are respectively identical to the monks’ suspension 10 at Bu Ss 10:1.3.16.1, 11 at Bu Ss 11:1.19.1, 12 at Bu Ss 12:1.26.1, and 13 at Bu Ss 13:1.8.10.1, with appropriate gender changes.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.14.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, sattarasa saṅghādisesā dhammā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.14.eng: “Venerables, the seventeen rules on suspension have been recited,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.15.eng: nine being immediate offenses, eight after the third announcement.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.16.pli: Yesaṃ bhikkhunī aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjati, tāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe pakkhamānattaṃ caritabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.16.eng: If a nun commits any one of them, she must undertake a trial period for a half-month toward both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.17.pli: Ciṇṇamānattā bhikkhunī yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhunisaṅgho tattha sā bhikkhunī abbhetabbā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.17.eng: When this is completed, she is to be rehabilitated wherever there is a sangha of at least twenty nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.18.pli: Ekāyapi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhunisaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuniṃ abbheyya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.18.eng: If that nun is rehabilitated by a sangha of nuns of even one less than twenty,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.19.pli: Sā ca bhikkhunī anabbhitā, tā ca bhikkhuniyo gārayhā, ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.19.eng: then that nun is not rehabilitated and those nuns are at fault. This is proper procedure.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.20.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.26.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.27.eng: The group of seventeen is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:3.28.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension in the Nuns’ Analysis is finished.
